caption.text:
Treatment guidelines incorporating DL
CO
or splenomegaly reduction as clinically significant outcomes.

cell.text:
•
Spleen volume should be expressed as multiples of normal with a treatment goal of 2–8 times reduction of normal and assessments at different time points up to 5 years

•
European Working Group on Gaucher Disease [
31
,
32
]
•
US Food and Drug Administration [
29
]
•
European Medical Association [
30
]

•
Reduction of ≥35% in spleen volume as assessed by MRI or CT is indicative of response to treatment

•
WHO International Working Group-Myeloproliferative Neoplasms Research and Treatment (IWG-MRT) and European LeukemiaNet consensus report [
35
]

•
A decrease of >15% DL
CO
in absolute values is associated with disease worsening/increased risk of mortality

•
2017 Spanish IPF guidelines [
58
,
59
]
•
2017 French IPF guidelines [
60
]

statement.text: The outcome is DL CO when the reference is • 2017 Spanish IPF guidelines [ , ] • 2017 French IPF guidelines [ ]

The value of • Reduction of ≥35% in spleen volume as assessed by MRI or CT is indicative of response to treatment for guideline corresponds to the value of • WHO International Working Group-Myeloproliferative Neoplasms Research and Treatment (IWG-MRT) and European LeukemiaNet consensus report [ ] for reference

The reference is • 2017 Spanish IPF guidelines [ , ] • 2017 French IPF guidelines [ ] when the guideline is • A decrease of >15% DL CO in absolute values is associated with disease worsening/increased risk of mortality

The reference is • European Working Group on Gaucher Disease [ , ] • US Food and Drug Administration [ ] • European Medical Association [ ] when the guideline is • Spleen volume should be expressed as multiples of normal with a treatment goal of 2–8 times reduction of normal and assessments at different time points up to 5 years
The value of DL CO for outcome corresponds to the value of • A decrease of >15% DL CO in absolute values is associated with disease worsening/increased risk of mortality for guideline

The reference is • 2017 Spanish IPF guidelines [ , ] • 2017 French IPF guidelines [ ] when the guideline is • Reduction of ≥35% in spleen volume as assessed by MRI or CT is indicative of response to treatment

The value of • WHO International Working Group-Myeloproliferative Neoplasms Research and Treatment (IWG-MRT) and European LeukemiaNet consensus report [ ] for reference corresponds to the value of • A decrease of >15% DL CO in absolute values is associated with disease worsening/increased risk of mortality for guideline
The value of DL CO for outcome corresponds to the value of • Reduction of ≥35% in spleen volume as assessed by MRI or CT is indicative of response to treatment for guideline

The value of • WHO International Working Group-Myeloproliferative Neoplasms Research and Treatment (IWG-MRT) and European LeukemiaNet consensus report [ ] for reference corresponds to the value of DL CO for outcome

The reference is • European Working Group on Gaucher Disease [ , ] • US Food and Drug Administration [ ] • European Medical Association [ ] when the guideline is • Reduction of ≥35% in spleen volume as assessed by MRI or CT is indicative of response to treatment

All the values in guideline are distinct.
Reference has no duplicate values.
Outcome always has the same value.
Outcome has no duplicate values.

caption.text:
ASMD observational and natural history studies of patients with chronic ASMD describing associations of DL
CO
or splenomegaly with morbidity, mortality or quality of life.

cell.text: Multicenter, multinational prospective, cross-sectional natural history study (US, Italy, Brazil, France and Germany)
59 pediatric or adult patients with chronic ASMD ranging in age from 7 to 65 years

Bleeding/bruising, increased liver volume, atherogenic lipid profile, below average height z scores, hematologic abnormalites, lung parameters (including fibrosis scores, % predicted DLco, % predicted FVC)
Retrospective and prospective natural history study (Belgium and the Netherlands)
25 pediatric or adult patients with chronic ASMD with up to 11 years of follow-up
No significant correlations between baseline spleen volume and platelets, lipids, DLco, bone marrow fat burden, chitotriosidase
Systematic evaluation of morbidity and mortality (US single center)
103 pediatric or adult patients with chronic ASMD ranging in age from 1 to 72 years
Assessment of bone scans (US single center)
46 pediatric or adult patients with chronic ASMD ranging in age from 1.6 to 54.5 years
Cross-sectional anlysis of growth in children (US single center)
23 children and adolescents with chronic ASMD ranging in age from 3.7 to 18.3 years
